SEARCH
Package com.conductor.core.model.application

Class Application

java.lang.Object
com.conductor.core.model.BaseEntity
com.conductor.core.model.Resource
com.conductor.core.model.application.Application
@Entity public class Application extends Resource
Application is used to model long-lived transaction involved during acquiring a Resource. An Application can be in multiple states as listed in ApplicationStatus. Once application is in 'approved' state this usually mean granting permissions to a new resource. In Conductor we use applications for the following:-

  • A user can apply to an Event. On approval get's a ticket to the event Through event's application organization's can set forms that must filled before a user can submit an application, this helps in the approval stage.
  • A user can register new Organization by filling a form and submitting an application. Conductor team can verify the application, approve it and start the onboarding process.
  • To manage disputes. Disputes can be caused within an organization, like for payments, permissions, or at system level, for example when a user gets blocked to apply for any event. Or for an organization to raise a concern. All this is handled by applications.

    • Method Details

      • createNew

        public static Application createNew(Resource targetResource, User submittedBy, String formResponse)
        Creates a new Application.
        Parameters:
        targetResource - target resource of this application. Must not be transient.
        submittedBy - user this application was submitted by. Must not be transient.
        formResponse - optional form response.
        Returns:
        A new application.

      • approve

        public void approve(User approvedBy)
        Approve the application.
        Parameters:
        approvedBy - user that approves this application
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the application is already in final state. see isFinalStatus() method.

      • reject

        public void reject(User rejectedBy, String rejectionReason)
        Reject the application. Rejection reason if provided gets added as a comment on the application.
        Parameters:
        rejectedBy - user that rejects this application
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the application is already in final state. see isFinalStatus() method.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancel the registration. Suppose to be done by user that submitted the application.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the application is already in final state. see isFinalStatus() method.

      • putComment

        public void putComment(User author, String comment)
        Add a new comment to the application.
